text: well
I uh had sold a company that matched up
high school students to colleges in 1968
I was 20 years old and uh I was involved
in some project and I didn't like the
way things were going and uh my manager
gave me this advice and says really all
you should worry about is is to meet
your own expectations set your standards
high and you should be you know your
most critical judge and then meet your
own standards and if you've done that
you're finished and then don't really
worry about what happens if you in fact
you do that good things will happen but
you don't really have to worry about
what other people think what the
response of the world is the sort of
superficial material success of the
project that'll take care of itself set
high standards and try to and try to
meet them and be your own most critical
judge and so I I I keep that in mind if
I get overly concerned about how
something is going uh and I do set high
standards for myself and uh the only
person that can declare failure is
yourself and I don't worry about my
Project's failing I worry about that I
might have a setback or it might and
therefore I'm going to have to work
harder and longer to achieve success but
perseverance in the end pays off
